items.label: def-os-reflection-operator
items.title: Euclidean Reflection Operator
items.content:
12: :label: def-os-reflection-operator
13: 
14: For a coordinate direction $\mu \in \{0, 1, 2, 3\}$, the **reflection operator** $\theta_\mu: \mathbb{R}^4 \to \mathbb{R}^4$ is defined by:
15: 
16: $$
17: \theta_\mu(x^0, x^1, x^2, x^3) := (x^0, \ldots, -x^\mu, \ldots, x^3)
18: $$
19: 
20: For the **time direction** (choosing $\mu = 0$), we write:
21: 
22: $$
23: \theta(x^0, \vec{x}) := (-x^0, \vec{x})
24: $$

items.raw_directive:
345: ### Gaussian Kernel Scale Parameter
346: 
347: :::{prf:definition} Companion Interaction Scale
348: :label: def-os-interaction-scale
349: 
350: The Crystalline Gas companion interaction kernel has a **scale parameter** $\sigma > 0$:
351: 
352: $$
353: K(x, y) = \exp\left(-\frac{\|x - y\|^2}{2\sigma^2}\right)
354: $$
355: 
356: This sets the **correlation length scale** for walker interactions:
357: - Walkers separated by $\|x - y\| \ll \sigma$ are **strongly coupled**
